description:
'''William  Paxton''' (May 17, 1955 – February 25, 2017) was an American actor, filmmaker and musician. A versatile [[character actor]] known for his distinctive [[Texas|Texan]] drawl and everyman screen persona, he was a four-time [[Golden Globe Awards|Golden Globe Award]] and a [[Primetime Emmy Award]] nominee, among other accolades.

Paxton starred in films ''[[Near Dark]]'' (1987), ''[[Tombstone (film)|Tombstone]]'' (1993), ''[[Apollo 13 (film)|Apollo 13]]'' (1995), ''[[Twister (1996 film)|Twister]]'' (1996),  ''[[Mighty Joe Young (1998 film)|Mighty Joe Young]]'' (1998), and ''[[A Simple Plan (film)|A Simple Plan]]'' (1998), and played supporting roles in ''[[Weird Science (film)|Weird Science]]'' (1985), ''[[Edge of Tomorrow]]'' (2014), and ''[[Nightcrawler (film)|Nightcrawler]]'' (2014). He was a close collaborator of director [[James Cameron]], appearing in his films [[The Terminator|''The Terminator'']] (1984), ''[[Aliens (film)|Aliens]]'' (1986), ''[[True Lies]]'' (1994), and ''[[Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]]'' (1997). He made his directorial debut with the 2001 horror film [[Frailty (2001 film)|''Frailty'']], in which he also starred, earning him [[Saturn Award]] nominations for [[Saturn Award for Best Director|Best Director]] and [[Saturn Award for Best Horror Film|Best Horror Film]].

On television, Paxton starred as Bill Henrickson on the [[HBO]] drama series ''[[Big Love]]'' (2006–2011), for which he earned three Golden Globe nominations for [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Television Series Drama|Best Actor – Television Series Drama]] during the show's run. He was nominated for an Emmy Award and a [[Screen Actors Guild Awards|Screen Actors Guild Award]] for portraying [[Randall McCoy]] in the [[History (U.S. TV network)|History Channel]] miniseries ''[[Hatfields & McCoys (miniseries)|Hatfields & McCoys]]'' (2012).
